actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on Oversight of Government Management, the Federal Workforce,  and the District of Columbia.

committees.committee: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Oversight of Government Management, the Federal Workforce, and the District of Columbia

official_title: A bill to ensure that Members of Congress do not receive better prescription drug benefits than medicare beneficiaries.
short_title: Taste of Our Own Medicine Act of 2005

summary.text: Taste of Our Own Medicine Act of 2005 - Prohibits the actuarial value of the prescription drug benefits of any Member of Congress enrolled in a Federal health benefits plan from exceeding the actuarial value of basic prescription drug coverage as defined in the Voluntary Prescription Drug Benefit Program of the Social Security Act.

titles.title: Taste of Our Own Medicine Act of 2005
Taste of Our Own Medicine Act of 2005
A bill to ensure that Members of Congress do not receive better prescription drug benefits than medicare beneficiaries.
